definition: to settle accounts/to clear accounts/to liquidate/to expose and criticize
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Qing1 suan4 Yin2 hang2

sentences.english: Forecasting the market-clearing price (MCP) is the most essential task for any decision-making in electricity market.
sentences.chinese: 市場清算電價預測是電力市場中交易決策的基礎。

sentences.english: Most analysts assumed that Inouye would liquidate the company.
sentences.chinese: 大部分分析人士認爲Inouye將清算公司。

sentences.english: Letter of authorization by member to settlement personnel.
sentences.chinese: 會員對清算人員的授權書。

sentences.english: The item 4 includes the explanation that three public announcements have been made within liquidation period;
sentences.chinese: 第4項應包括清算期內已公告三次的說明。

sentences.english: By all appearances, this is a moment of reckoning for salt.
sentences.chinese: 各種跡象表明，這是對鹽進行清算的時刻。

sentences.english: Gains are realized when assets are liquidated to cash.
sentences.chinese: 當資產進行清算兌現後，收益得以實現。

sentences.english: There'll never be closure, but there will be a reckoning with the past.
sentences.chinese: 歷史不會石沉大海，總會有清算的那一天”。

sentences.english: Article 58 When a privately-run school is to be terminated, it shall make financial settlement according to law.
sentences.chinese: 第五十八條民辦學校終止時，應當依法進行財務清算。

sentences.english: The new company has duly taken over all accounts outstanding and will take all responsibility for the settlement of accounts。
sentences.chinese: 新的公司已接管了一切未了帳目，並將負責清算。

sentences.english: Secondly, the introduction of land value increment tax.
sentences.chinese: 鑽井政策“漏洞”，不及時清算土地增值稅。

sentences.english: Dark pools charge trading fees, while light pools work mostly in clearing.
sentences.chinese: 黑池收取交易費，而白池主要負責清算。

sentences.english: Four, drilling policy "loopholes" and not to the timely liquidation of land value increment tax.
sentences.chinese: 鑽井政策“漏洞”，不及時清算土地增值稅。

sentences.english: This means that minority shareholders must agree to a sale or liquidation of a company.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着少數股股東必須贊成公司的出售或清算。

sentences.english: The reasons for dissolution of the company and liquidation methods.
sentences.chinese: 公司的解散事由與清算辦法。

sentences.english: Yet, at the same time, the BIS wants to eat its cake and have it too.
sentences.chinese: 然而，國際清算銀行其實是在希望能魚與熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: The notification for registration must state the extent of the power of representation of the liquidators.
sentences.chinese: 申報時，必須說明清算人的代表權。

definition: to demand payment of money owing
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to settle a bill/to close an account
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
